title: ALBI (Albumin-Bilirubin) Grade for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)
desc: The ALBI (Albumin-Bilirubin) Grade for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) predicts survival in HCC patients.

orgreference.text: Johnson PJ, Berhane S, Kagebayashi C, et al. Assessment of liver function in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma: a new evidence-based approach-the ALBI grade. J Clin Oncol. 2015;33(6):550-8.

other_refer.text: Hiraoka A, Kumada T, Kudo M, et al. Albumin-Bilirubin (ALBI) Grade as Part of the Evidence-Based Clinical Practice Guideline for HCC of the Japan Society of Hepatology: A Comparison with the Liver Damage and Child-Pugh Classifications. Liver Cancer. 2017;6(3):204-215.

data.evidence: ALBI = (log10 bilirubin × 0.66) + (albumin × -0.085), where bilirubin is in μmol/L and albumin in g/L.
